metadata.title: CVE-2022-47929 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel before 6.1.6, a NULL pointer dereference bug in thetraffic control subsystem allows an unprivileged user to trigger a denialof service (system crash) via a crafted traffic control configuration thatis set up with "tc qdisc" and "tc class" commands. This affects qdisc_graftin net/sched/sch_api.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-47929` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-239-generic - 4.4.0-239.273
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-239-generic - 4.4.0-239.273
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-239-lowlatency - 4.4.0-239.273
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-208-generic - 4.15.0-208.219~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-208-generic - 4.15.0-208.219~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-208-lowlatency - 4.15.0-208.219~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1118-kvm - 4.4.0-1118.128
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1155-aws - 4.4.0-1155.170
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1153-aws - 4.15.0-1153.166~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1162-azure - 4.15.0-1162.177~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1088-fips - 4.4.0-1088.95
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1088-fips - 4.4.0-1088.95
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-1088-fips - 4.4.0-1088.95
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1088-fips - 4.4.0-1088.95
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1147-gcp - 4.15.0-1147.163~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1116-oracle - 4.15.0-1116.127~16.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-239.273').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-208.219~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1118.128').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1155.170').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1153.166~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1162.177~16.04.1').
linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1088.95').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1147.163~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1116.127~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
